#! /usr/bin/env python

"""
	create Library of variables : Read saved model file (current formats: csv, )
"""

import csv
import re
import copy

#import path.getmtime as getmtime
import time
genabspath = os.path.abspath
getmtime = os.path.getmtime
ctime = time.ctime

# change a key (vKey) of an element name (vName) from variable library (Lib) to something else (vToo)

[docs]def change_a_type (Lib, vName, vKey, vToo):
	# get index of name to change
	index = Lib.names.index(vName)
	# change the key element to new value
	##print str(Lib.data_store[-1][index])
	##print str(Lib.data_store[-1][index][vKey])
	Lib.data[index][vKey] = vToo;
	Lib.data_vec[index][vKey] = vToo;
	##print str(Lib.data_store[-1][index][vKey])

	# check if key exists in key lib
	#self.info['keys']

	table = []
	def __init__(self, g_abspath_title, name_of_file_list):
		self.full_path = genabspath(g_abspath_title)
		#print ";;;;;;;;;" + self.full_path
		self.g_title = g_abspath_title.rsplit('/')[-1] #.rsplit('\\',1)
		self.directory = genabspath(g_abspath_title.rsplit('/',1)[0])
		##print self.directory
		self.nofl = name_of_file_list	
		self.null = "NULL"
		self.table = []
		self.ischanged = range(len(name_of_file_list)) # change to single line code - all 1 value
		for i in range(len(self.ischanged)):
			self.ischanged[i] = 0
		#self.nof = name_of_file
		
		# determines if we regenerate the parsed files if they have been edited
		# total value must equal len of input files if we choose NOT to update
		REGENERATE = 0 # default: set to not generate files

		fprop = pickle.load(open(memfilename, 'rb')) #-- get dictionary of same name values
		fcomb = pickle.load(open(memfilename_comb, 'rb')) #-- get dictionary of combinations done
		if fprop is None:
			fprop = dict()
			pdump(fprop,memfilename) 
			##print "file created!"
		if fcomb is None:
			fcomb = dict()
			pdump(fcomb,memfilename_comb) 
			#print "combination file created!"
			
		##print fcomb
		for i in range(len(name_of_file_list)):
			current_fprop_path = genabspath(genabspath(name_of_file_list[i])).replace('/','_').replace('/','_')[1:]
			#-- get time stamp values
			current_fprop_tstamp =  getmtime(genabspath(name_of_file_list[i]))
			##print current_fprop_path
			if current_fprop_path in fprop: # if this item exist in dict, compare to current value
				# if values equal, it doesn't need repeating so far...
				##print "the path contained here has the following timestamp..."
				##print fprop[current_fprop_path]
				##print current_fprop_tstamp
				if fprop[current_fprop_path] == current_fprop_tstamp:
					REGENERATE = REGENERATE + 1
					self.ischanged[i] = 1
					#print "same time stamp..."
				else: # !vital! remove all combinations of name_of_file_list[i] as this file has changed
					for k in fcomb.keys():
						##print k
						##print list(fprop[k])
						#if isinstance(fcomb[k],list):
						##print fcomb[k]
						#print str(fprop[current_fprop_path]) + "==" + str(current_fprop_tstamp) + "???"
						#print fcomb[k]
						#print name_of_file_list[i]
						#if list(fcomb[k]).index(name_of_file_list[i]):
						if name_of_file_list[i] in list(fcomb[k]):
							del fcomb[k]
							#print "del the combination"
					#print "do we have to reset time stamp once we deleted again [deletion on]???"
			else:
				fprop[current_fprop_path] = current_fprop_tstamp;
				#print "it never even existed"
		##print fprop.keys()
		
		#if self.full_path not in fcomb:
		#	REGENERATE = 0
		##print REGENERATE
		
		#-- now check if it has been been done before?
		#- if REGENERATION is equal 3, set into each 
		#for keys in fcomb
		#if REGENERATION == len(name_of_file_list):
		#	fcomb[self.g_title] = name_of_file_list
		#- if RE
		
		#pickle.dump(fcomb,open(memfilename, 'wb'))	
		
			
		#-- gather variables from the files combined - remove duplicates (how does it do this?)
		try:				
			for i in range(len(name_of_file_list)):
				fn_extension = name_of_file_list[i].rsplit('.',1)[1]
				if fn_extension == "csv":
					self.table = self.table + [row for row in csv.reader(open(name_of_file_list[i],'rU'), delimiter=',') if row != []]
				elif fn_extension == "another_extension":
					pass
				else:
					error ("incorrect extension")
				##print len(self.table)
		except:
			error ("Error: incorrect filename and/or extension given.\n:: " + str(name_of_file_list) + " does not exist")
		
		# 0. 
		# SOF: How do you remove duplicates from a list in python whilst preserving order?
		#self.table
		allthenames=[row[1] for row in self.table if row[0][0] != '%']
		##print allthenames.index('I_IP3')
		
		
		# 1. store title, 
		self.info = {}; self.names = []
		#print "REGENERATE = " + str(REGENERATE)
		#for elem in fcomb:
			#print "-----=====" + str(elem)
		#print "!!!!- = " + self.full_path
		# 'if regenerated is at the maximum allowed, all are time stamped'
		if REGENERATE == len(name_of_file_list) and (self.full_path in fcomb):
			#if self.directory in fprop:
			self.info['doWeParse'] = 0;
			print ":: NOT Regenerated"
		else:
			self.info['doWeParse'] = 1;
			print ":: Renerated"
			
		pickle.dump(fprop,open(memfilename, 'wb'))
		pickle.dump(fcomb,open(memfilename_comb, 'wb'))

		##print fprop
		#print "::: do we parse:::" + str(self.info['doWeParse'])
		##print self.info['doWeParse']
		self.info['title'] = self.g_title #self.table[0][1]
		self.info['keys'] = ['type', 'name', 'comment', 'dimension', 'init-value', 'print', 'userdef', 'rhs']
		self.info['const_keys'] = ["type", "name"]
		self.info['defualt'] = {'comment': "{unknown}", 'dimension': "n/a", 'init-value': '0', 
										'print': 'NO', 'userdef': 'NO', 'rhs': 'NULL'} # default value for each key
		self.info['function'] = []	# function order
		# 2. generate data as a list of dictionaries
		#self.data_store = [[dict(zip(self.info['keys'],values)) for values in self.table if not values[0][0] == "%"]]
		self.data_store = [self.create_data()]
		
		#self.data_store = [[dict(zip(self.info['keys'],values)) for values in self.table if not values[0] in ["%", "TITLE"]]]
		##print self.data_store
		self.data = self.data_store[0]
		self.d_counter = False
		self.size_vars = 0		#2aa size_name is size of total variables
		for elem in self.data:
			self.names.append(elem['name']) # 2ab
			self.size_vars += 1	# 2aa
		self.info['range'] = range(len(self.names))
		#self.info['namemap'] = dict(zip([elem['name'] for elem in self.data],range(len(self.names))))
		
		self.vec = [] # vectorized data
		#self.vec.append ([dict(zip(self.h_keys,values)) for values in [elem + [elem[3]] for elem in table] if not values[0] in ["%", "TITLE"]])
		# 2b. get total values available
		self.info['total'] = len(self.data)
		##print "total: " +  str(self.info['total'])
		# 3 organise index and dependency orders
		#self.info['index']['ode'] = {}; self.info['index']['var'] = {};
		#self.info['index']['ode']['yes'] = 
		###tt = Timer()
		###tt.start()
		self.info['index'] = {'order': {}}
		self.add_index (['ode','yes'],{'type': 'ODE'})
		self.add_index (['ode','no'],{'type': 'VAR'})
		self.add_index (['var','yes'],{'type': 'VAR'})
		self.add_index (['var','no'],{'type': 'ODE'})
		self.add_index (['userdef','yes'],{'userdef': 'YES'})
		self.add_index (['userdef','no'],{'userdef': 'NO'})
		self.add_index (['print','yes'],{'print': 'YES'})
		self.add_index (['print','no'],{'print': 'NO'})
		self.add_index (['rhs','yes'],{},{'rhs': 'NULL'})
		self.add_index (['rhs','no'],{'rhs': 'NULL'})		
		self.add_index (['init-value','yes'],{'init-value': 'NULL'})
		self.add_index (['init-value','no'],{},{'init-value': 'NULL'})
		
		self.info['index']['order']['init-value'] = self.get_index_dependency ('init-value', 'name')


		##print "last: " + str(len(self.data))
		#for elem in self.data:
		#	#print elem
		#for elem in self.info['index']['userdef']['yes']:
		#	#print elem
		
		pass
		

[docs]	def change_variable (self, mname, mval):
		m = self.names.index(mname)
		self.data[m]['init-value'] = str(mval)
		for elem in range(len(self.data_store)):
			self.data_store[elem][m]['init-value'] = str(mval)
		#for elem in range(len(self.data_store)):
		#	self.data_store[elem][m]['init-value'] = str(mval)		
		
	# add current time, one can add only before defining parsers	


[docs]	def add_variable (self, mDict):
		#self.info['keys'] = ['type', 'comment', 'dimension', 'name', 'init-value', 'print', 'userdef', 'rhs']
		orig_keys = self.info['keys']
		# check if there are key properties which dont exit in our library
		if set(mDict.keys()).issubset(orig_keys) is False: error("Keys defined in var dict are not part of original values\nMust be part of the following attributes: " + str(orig_keys))
		# check if values are correct,
		for key in mDict.keys():
			if key == 'type':
				if key not in ['ODE','VAR'] : error('var creation: \'type\' (is \'ODE\' or \'VAR\')')
			elif key == 'name':
				if mDict['name'][0].isdigit(): error('var creation: \'name\'')
		#for key in orig_keys:
	


[docs]	def function_order (self, *argv):
		#if set(mDict.keys()).issubset(self.names) is False: 
		#	error("Keys defined in var dict are not part of original values\nMust be part of the following attributes: " + str(orig_keys))
		if not argv:
			None
			##print "HELLO"
		else: 
			names_rhs = []
			for it in self.info['index']['rhs']['yes']:
				names_rhs.append (self.names[it])
			arg_names = [item for sublist in argv for item in sublist['rhs']]
			new_occ =  list(set(arg_names) - set(names_rhs))	# these items are not declared in RHS
			old_occ = list(set(names_rhs) - set(arg_names))		# these items are apparent new items
			if new_occ:
				error('(function_order) - The following items are not declared as a rhs function in library, please check the spelling, or if this variable has a rhs defined: ' + str(new_occ))
			elif old_occ:
				error('(function_order) - The following items you defined does not exist: ' + str(old_occ))
			
			for i in range(len(argv)):
				argv[i]['index'] = [self.names.index(elem) for elem in argv[i]['rhs']]
			self.info['function'] = argv
		
		##print old_occ
		#for elem in mDict.values():
		#	#print elem
		#self.info['function'] = 
		###self.info['function'] 

	# there may be faster ethods to find duplicates, as in this SOF page
	# http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5419204/index-of-duplicates-items-in-a-python-list
	# http://stackoverflow.com/questions/716477/join-list-of-lists-in-python
	# this one is modified


[docs]	def dup2 (self, n): #n="123123123"
		counter=Counter(n) #{'1': 3, '3': 3, '2': 3}
		dups=[i for i in counter if counter[i]!=1] #['1','3','2']
		#result={}
		#for item in dups:
		#	result[item]=[i for i,j in enumerate(n) if j==item]
		#jj = [[i for i,j in enumerate(n) if j==item] for item in dups]
		##print jj
		return sorted([inner for outer in [i[1:] for i in 
				[[i for i,j in enumerate(n) if j==item] for item in dups]] for inner in outer],
				key=int,reverse=True)
		#return result
                        


[docs]	def create_data (self):
		a = [dict(zip(self.info['keys'],values)) for values in self.table if not values[0][0] == "%"]
		##print len(a)
		# the data created gives us the YES,NO section of userdef. Therefore we change this value to correspond to what init value looks like
		##print a
		#for i in range(len(a)):
			# the re does not seem to work but should be faster, forget for now
			#if (re.match(r'^[a-zA-Z]+',str(a[i]['init-value']))):
			#if any(c.isalpha() for c in str(a[i]['init-value'])):
			#if(a[i]['init-value'].isdigit()):
			#	dd = 1
			#	#print "hello"
			#else:
			#	dd = 0			
			##print a[i]['name'] + ":\n aUDef?: " + str(dd) + "\tIV:" + a[i]['init-value']

		
		t_names = [x['name'] for x in a]
		b2 = self.dup2(t_names)
		for elem in b2:
			a.pop(elem)
		#b2keys = b2.keys()
		##print b2keys
		return a

		#self.vec.append ([dict(zip(self.h_keys,values)) for values in [elem + [elem[3]] for elem in self.table] if not values[0] in ["%", "TITLE"]])
		#mkeys = self.info['keys']
		#if self.d_counter is False:
		#	##print ":::::HELLO"
		#	self.d_counter = True
		#	for elem in self.info['index']['userdef']['yes']:
		#		self.data_store[-1][elem]['init-value'] = self.data[elem]['init-value']
		#	#print self.data_store
		#	return self.data_store[-1]
		#else:
		#self.data_store.append ([dict(zip(self.info['keys'],values)) for values in self.table if not values[0][0] == "%"])
		self.data_store.append(self.create_data())
		#	for elem in self.info['index']['userdef']['yes']:
		#		self.data_store[-1][elem]['init-value'] = self.data[elem]['init-value']
		return self.data_store[-1]
		


[docs]	def copy_lib_vec (self):		
		#self.vec.append ([dict(zip(self.h_keys,values)) for values in [elem + [elem[3]] for elem in self.table] if not values[0] in ["%", "TITLE"]])
		mkeys = self.info['keys']
		#self.vec.append ([dict(zip(self.info['keys'],values)) for values in self.table if not values[0][0] == "%"])
		self.vec.append (self.create_data())
		for elem in self.info['index']['userdef']['yes']:
			self.vec[-1][elem]['init-value'] = self.data[elem]['init-value']
		return self.vec[-1]
		


[docs]	def get_index_dependency (self, m_key_to_order = 'init-value', resp_order_val = "name", cond_remove = {}, cond_include = {}):
		# SOF:: How to find all occurenceies of an element in list?   <-- figure how to do this in list coprehension (?)
		if isinstance(m_key_to_order, basestring):
			key_to_order = m_key_to_order
		ko = re.split
		dependencies = filter(None, [entity[key_to_order] if entity[key_to_order] != self.null else '' for entity in self.data])
		##print dependencies
		#if key_to_order == "rhs":
		#	#print dependencies
		dependencies = [[x for x in y if not x[0].isdigit()] for y in \
				[filter(None, elem) for elem in \
				[ko(r'(?:\.|\^| |\+|\*|-|/|\)|\(|\]\]|\[\[|\|\||,|log10|exp|log|| )',elem) for elem in dependencies]]]
		d_name = [entity[resp_order_val] if entity[key_to_order] != self.null else '' for entity in self.data]
		r_index = []
		for elem in d_name:
			if elem != '':
				r_index.append(d_name.index(elem))
		##print r_index
		# remove elements in d_name and dependecies if not bothered about them
		if cond_remove:
			counter_d = 0
			r_index_len = len(r_index);
			while counter_d < r_index_len:
				for mkey in cond_remove.keys():
					if str(self.data[r_index[counter_d]][mkey]) == str(cond_remove[mkey]):
						r_index.pop (counter_d)
						#r_index_range.pop (counter_d)
						dependencies.pop (counter_d)
						d_name.pop (counter_d)
						r_index_len -= 1
					else:
						counter_d += 1

		counter_d = 0
		for i in range(len(r_index)-1,-1,-1):
			if dependencies[i]:
				r_index.append (r_index.pop(i))
				d_name.append (d_name.pop(i))
				dependencies.append (dependencies.pop(i))
				counter_d += 1

		counter_d = len(dependencies) - counter_d	
		while counter_d < len(r_index):
			if not set(dependencies[counter_d]).intersection (d_name[counter_d:]):
				counter_d += 1
			else:
				r_index.append (r_index.pop(counter_d))
				d_name.append (d_name.pop(counter_d))
				dependencies.append (dependencies.pop(counter_d))

		return r_index

		


[docs]	def add_index (self, define_dict_keys , cond_on = {}, cond_not_on = {}):
		
		
		# add dic keys
		a = self.info['index'];
		for elem in define_dict_keys[:-1]:
			if elem not in a.keys():
				##print elem + " does not exist"
				a[elem] = {}
			a = a[elem]			
		a[define_dict_keys[-1]] = []
		
		indexes_on = []; indexes_not_on = []
		
		seen = set(); seen_add = seen.add		
		for key in cond_on.keys():
			if key in self.data[0].keys():
				indexes_on += [i for i, x in enumerate(self.data) if x[key] == cond_on[key]]
			else: error("stop")
		indexes_on = [x for x in indexes_on if x not in seen and not seen_add(x)]
		
		seen = set(); seen_add = seen.add
		for key in cond_not_on.keys():
			if key in self.data[0].keys():
				indexes_not_on += [i for i, x in enumerate(self.data) if x[key] == cond_not_on[key]]
			else: error("stop")
		indexes_not_on = [x for x in indexes_not_on if x not in seen and not seen_add(x)]			
		
		##print indexes_on
		##print indexes_not_on
		##print ":::"
		
		if not cond_on:
			indexes_on = range(0,self.info['total'])
		
		for elem in indexes_not_on:
			if elem in indexes_on:
				indexes_on.remove(elem)

		##print str(define_dict_keys) + "  " + str(indexes_on)
		a[define_dict_keys[-1]] = indexes_on
		#return indexes_on;

[docs]	def set_directory(self):
		"""Set directory where file specific parser files are saved to, 
		the directory can be a relative path and not necessarily an absolute path
		
		:param dir_str: string of path to directory
		"""
		#print self.directory
		if isinstance(self.directory, str) is False: error("set_directory argument not a string")
		elif not self.directory: pass
		#elif (os.path.isdir(self.directory)) is False: error("directory does not exist")
		else: 
			#self.directory = self.directory
			# extra
			if not os.path.exists(self.directory + "/" + self.g_title):
				os.makedirs(self.directory + "/" + self.g_title)	
		##print self.directory

				


[docs]	def complete(self):
		fcomb = pickle.load(open(memfilename_comb, 'rb')) #-- get dictionary of combinations done
		##print ">>> " + self.full_path
		fcomb[self.full_path] = self.nofl
		##print ">>> " + self.full_path
		pickle.dump(fcomb,open(memfilename_comb, 'wb'))
		if self.info['doWeParse'] == 1:
			fprop = pickle.load(open(memfilename, 'rb'))
			for i in range(len(self.nofl)):
				#if self.ischanged[i]==1
				current_fprop_path = genabspath(genabspath(self.nofl[i])).replace('/','_').replace('/','_')[1:]
				current_fprop_tstamp =  getmtime(genabspath(self.nofl[i]))
				fprop[current_fprop_path] = current_fprop_tstamp;
			pickle.dump(fprop, open(memfilename, 'wb'))
